you've had a quick look just to make sure you
don't want the changelog entries grouped or
modified.

subject: drm: simplify device open
commitMessage:
drm: simplify device open

libdrm's open functions are just wrappers around open(), and our
detection of which parameter to pass to drmOpen() is not 100%
reliable.

Simplify the code and just call open() directly.

Bug: https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=71590
Origin: upstream, http://cgit.freedesktop.org/plymouth/commit/?id=10e0810976722e746c2cdf1a77f5964703ee3387
Change-Id: If830eb866d1c37417a427ecc70d07acdf5def0f4
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Sasiak <k.sasiak@samsung.com>

subject: Making initrd/dracut dependencies conditional
commitMessage:
Making initrd/dracut dependencies conditional

On some devices there might be no initrd/dracut, so the dependency prevents
this package from being installed. This patch removes this issue. Works only
when tizen_platform_noinitrd constant is defined when building via GBS.

Change-Id: I4e8825b2daa829cf7c276a103a7c427747fd4090
Signed-off-by: Krzysztof Sasiak <k.sasiak@samsung.com>

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This brings back configure option dropped by following change:

  https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/9859/1

  commit d1ef9daa83e6306d6cb877922671d87951352194
  Author: Ikey Doherty <ikey@solusos.com>
  Date:   Tue Sep 3 22:14:48 2013 +0100

    drm: drop driver specific renderers
    
    All the major modesetting drivers support the generic interface now, so
    there's no reason to have driver specific code.


I guess it was dropped by mistake as it seems only slightly related to 'driver-specific renderers'

Patch Set 1:

This also brought back by upstream:

  http://cgit.freedesktop.org/plymouth/commit/?id=c5a9005b1c3219f8dabf4926e450064fef6bf775

We need to either keep this commit as is or backport one linked above.  I'm ok with both options.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: drm: drop driver specific renderers
commitMessage:
drm: drop driver specific renderers

All the major modesetting drivers support the generic interface now, so
there's no reason to have driver specific code.

This commit drops all that extra code and hard codes the generic interface

Change-Id: I59378a36e6600fc9327d2c472bc5b9de7e21dc4f
Bug-Tizen: TZPC-4390
